8 hours ago, Cd109 said:

anyone know where can find a version of this mod for ksp 1.6.1 trying to make my RP1 Ro play through prettier

I also need that because the versions I have installed aren´t working properly in my experience.

I am using last version from this:

https://github.com/c1usta/KS3P/releases

But I will try beta 2 now to see if its better.

Edited March 7, 2020 by Agustin

On 3/7/2020 at 6:03 AM, Agustin said:
On 3/6/2020 at 9:33 PM, Cd109 said:

anyone know where can find a version of this mod for ksp 1.6.1 trying to make my RP1 Ro play through prettier

I also need that because the versions I have installed aren´t working properly in my experience.

I am using last version from this:

https://github.com/c1usta/KS3P/releases

But I will try beta 2 now to see if its better.

On "releases" page you can find KS3P version compiled for KSP 1.6.1. There is no changes for this particular compilation between beta2 and beta3.

3 minutes ago, clusta said:

On "releases" page you can find KS3P version compiled for KSP 1.6.1. There is no changes for this particular compilation between beta2 and beta3.

Thanks for your reply, but it seems as the page only has version 1.7.3 as the lowest.  Am i missing something ?  Great work guys thanks for your time

20 minutes ago, Cd109 said:

Thanks for your reply, but it seems as the page only has version 1.7.3 as the lowest.  Am i missing something ?  Great work guys thanks for your time

https://github.com/c1usta/KS3P/releases/download/6.1.2-b3/KS3P-1.6.1-6.1.2-Beta3.zip

It doesnt work right for me in 1.6.1. it disables when I try to go into the settings.

Edited March 8, 2020 by Agustin
thanks ill try it
Hi, I installed this mod to make my ksp RSS / RO modpack prettier, but once the game starts ks3p doesn't work, would anyone know why?

On 3/14/2020 at 7:15 AM, UZZO007 said:

Hi, I installed this mod to make my ksp RSS / RO modpack prettier, but once the game starts ks3p doesn't work, would anyone know why?

I believe it is not currently patched for 1.9.X, I may be incorrect, but I too, have been unable to utilize the mod. I suggest patiently waiting for the next update, as I am certain that the mod maker is doing their best! Cheers!

TUFX is basically the replacement for KS3P. KS3P is based on the official v1 unity post processing pack; TUFX is based on v2. v3 uses Unity's all new rendering pipeline, so it will probably never make it into KSP.

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/192212-19x-tufx-post-processing/
Recompiled for KSP 1.9.1: https://github.com/c1usta/KS3P/releases

On 4/7/2020 at 3:33 PM, clusta said:

Recompiled for KSP 1.9.1: https://github.com/c1usta/KS3P/releases

Thank you!!!!

This mod literally destroys my FPS.

Before using mod: 50 - 60fps

With mod: 30 - 35fps

I am using this in 1.7.3 with Real Solar System. I have tried tweaking things but there is not change occurring. Also the default profile does nothing.

Nvm I figured it out. I had the wrong configs

Edited May 7, 2020 by PatelPratham

21 hours ago, Prathtel said:

I am using this in 1.7.3 with Real Solar System. I have tried tweaking things but there is not change occurring. Also the default profile does nothing

Well I don't really have the best computer. I5 7200U Intel HD graphics 620 8gb ram win10

On 5/7/2020 at 2:13 AM, AnimaticalProductions said:

Well I don't really have the best computer. I5 7200U Intel HD graphics 620 8gb ram win10

Well, when I play on my Lenovo laptop (I7 8550, 16gb of RAM, same iGPU) I don't use any visual mod at all (except Restock if we consider the reworked plume of its engines being a visual mod).
There is a huge difference of framerate between in space rendering and LKO/surface rendering.

On 5/15/2020 at 3:13 AM, OnlyLightMatters said:

Well, when I play on my Lenovo laptop (I7 8550, 16gb of RAM, same iGPU) I don't use any visual mod at all (except Restock if we consider the reworked plume of its engines being a visual mod).
There is a huge difference of framerate between in space rendering and LKO/surface rendering.

The only visual mod that I use is Sci-fi visual enhancements, and the only difference in framerate is when I am either: Seeing the clouds, inside the clouds, or LKO.
Anyone have configs for astronomers visual pack?

On 2/24/2020 at 10:55 PM, Skarlinger said:

Hey Guys,

Have just started using KS3P on a 1.8.x build of KSP and have run into a strange issue and was wondering if anyone new a fix.  I have the 1.8 Beta that c1usta has so kindly worked on and get the following wierdness happening to the skybox when I go into either map view or into the tracking station.  In flight it looks fine though.

https://imgur.com/IIK7zS7

Cheers!

Having this same issue. Anyone know a solution? From screwing with settings, the effect seems to be caused by the colour grading effect, and goes away when disabled, however, that's one of the nicer post-processing effects... Would love to be able to use it. Thanks!

On 6/1/2020 at 11:34 PM, RyGuy_McFly said:

Having this same issue. Anyone know a solution? From screwing with settings, the effect seems to be caused by the colour grading effect, and goes away when disabled, however, that's one of the nicer post-processing effects... Would love to be able to use it. Thanks!

same here, really want to be able to use the color grading feature.

Edited June 10, 2020 by PupPryde

On 6/10/2020 at 8:08 AM, PupPryde said:

same here, really want to be able to use the color grading feature.

I use this version and it works well for me. Use the Clusta settings. KS3P-1.8.0-6.1.2-Beta1

so i recently installed, and i would like to get rid of the shadows while in the editor, it just feels a bit to dark for me, is there a way to do this?

 

and maybe make things a little brighter as well?

Edited July 3, 2020 by Not a Spy

On 6/24/2020 at 1:30 PM, CSA said:

I use this version and it works well for me. Use the Clusta settings. KS3P-1.8.0-6.1.2-Beta1

Tried that version, same issue, using the default settings.

EDIT: Full reinstall of KS3P fixed the issue.

Edited July 25, 2020 by RyGuy_McFly

8 hours ago, Krazy1 said:

I'm seeing error spam with v6.1 on KSP 1.10 from map view. I know it's not released for 1.10 but FYI:

I think KS3P is abandoned. The mod owner hasn't logged in here for 10 months. Last Github change is 14 months old for KSP 1.7.

Consider TUFX as an alternative. That's not updated yet, either, but maybe the 1.9 version will work well enough for you in 1.10, or watch that thread for a 1.10 update:

There is a 1.8 "beta" that works fine in 1.10, but I recommend just using TUFX, which essentially does the same thing but better. 

I believe you can download it here https://github.com/c1usta/KS3P/releases
